severe-malaria.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

medications.text: Paracetamol, every 4-6 hours until symptoms disappear.

severe-malaria.other-recommendations: Recommended that patients use insecticide-treated nets (ITNs) .

malaria.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience a worsening of their symptoms.

medications.text: Artemether-Lumefantrine (ALU), first dose, 2mg/kg Artemether and 12mg/kg Lumefantrine, for uncomplicated malaria.

malaria.other-recommendations: Begin patient on ALU/Quinine and document with patient. Give diazepam if convulsing and document.

pneumonia.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

medications.text: Amoxycillin capsule, 250mg. For over 10 years, given 250-500mg every 8 hours for 5 days.

pneumonia.other-recommendations: If the patient is a smoker, recommend that they stop smoking.

tb.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

coryza.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience difficulty breathing or excessive coughing.
coryza.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient self-isolate and treats symptoms. Patient should rest and drink plenty of fluids.

sinusitis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience severe pain, difficulty breathing, or excessive and recurrent coughing.
sinusitis.other-recommendations: Recommend the patient uses a warm compresses to ease pain in the nose and sinuses.

bronchiolitis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience a worsening of their symptoms.
bronchiolitis.other-recommendations: It is not recommended that the patient takes antibiotics, as this is not a bacterial infection.

bronchitis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience a worsening of their symptoms.
bronchitis.other-recommendations: It is not recommended that the patient takes antibiotics, as this is not a bacterial infection.

gastritis.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 2 days if symptoms worsen.
gastritis.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient avoid acidic foods or foods that aggravate the pain. Patient should drink a lot of fluids.

otitis-externa.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care.
otitis-externa.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient stays away from swimming or putting water in their ears.

supprative-otitis-media.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 2 days.
supprative-otitis-media.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient observes their symptoms and keeps their ear canal clean. Complications can occur such as loss of hearing.

otitis-media.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek immediate care if If their symptoms get worse, do not resolve, or if there is tympanic perforation.

medications.text: Amoxicillin, 90mg/kg (max 3g a day) divided into 3 doses. If <2 years, take for 2 weeks. If >2 years, take for 7 days.

otitis-media.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient stays away from swimming or putting water in their ears.

trichuriasis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience a worsening of their symptoms.

medications.text: Albendazole, 400mg, one time per day for 3 days

trichuriasis.other-recommendations: Recommend that patient practices good hygeine and regularly washes their hands. If the patient is a child, provide counseling on deworming tablets.

conjunctivitis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if their symptoms do not resolve.
conjunctivitis.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient practices good hygeine and regularly washes their hands.

uti.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience a worsening of their symptoms or if their symptoms do not resolve.
uti.other-recommendations: Provide counseling to patient on prevention menthods and recommend a follow-up after 5 months at a higher facility.

dysentry.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

malnutrition.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

ascariasis-changed-from-helminthiasis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience severe abdominal pain, if the patient is underweight, or if there are any emergency signs.

medications.text: Albendazole, 400mg, one time per day for 3 days

ascariasis-changed-from-helminthiasis.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient practices good hygeine and regularly washes their hands.

asthma.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.
asthma.other-recommendations: If the patient smokes, recommend that they stop smoking. Recommend that the patient avoids any triggers, if they are known.

influenza.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience difficulty breathing or excessive coughing.
influenza.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient self-isolate and treats symptoms. Patient should rest and drink plenty of fluids.

tonsilitis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience difficulty breathing, if they cannot eat, if their symptoms come back, or if this is the second time with this condition.
tonsilitis.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient rests at home.

laryngitis.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 24 hours.
laryngitis.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient rests their voice.

covid-19.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience difficulty breathing, chest pain, or excessive coughing.
covid-19.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient self-isolate and treats symptoms. Patient should rest and drink plenty of fluids.

copd.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 2 weeks.
copd.other-recommendations: If the patient smokes, recommend that they stop smoking. Provide counseling to the patient on eating nutritious meals.

syphillis.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 24 hours.
syphillis.other-recommendations: Provide counseling to the patient on prevention methods, infection, and continuation of treatment.

gonorrhea.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 2 days.
gonorrhea.other-recommendations: Provide counseling to the patient on prevention methods, infection, and continuation of treatment.

hiv-aids.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.
hiv-aids.other-recommendations: Provide counseling to the patient on prevention methods, infection, and continuation of treatment.

bacterial-vaginosis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience these symptoms frequently or if their condition is recurrent.

vulvovaginal-candidiasis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience these symptoms frequently or if their condition is recurrent.
vulvovaginal-candidiasis.other-recommendations: Provide counseling to the patient on prevention practices and encourage good hygeine.

trichomoniasis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care.

acute-watery-diarrhoea.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they are severely dehydrated or if their symptoms do not resolve.
acute-watery-diarrhoea.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient rests at home.

chlamydia.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 2 days.
chlamydia.other-recommendations: Provide counseling to the patient on prevention methods, infection, and continuation of treatment.

g-herpes.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

pelvic-inflammatory-disease.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.
pelvic-inflammatory-disease.other-recommendations: This condition can result in severe complications. Recommend that the patient seeks immediate care.

genital-warts.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience a worsening of their symptoms.
genital-warts.other-recommendations: If the warts continue to return or cause severe pain, recommend that the patient goes to a health facility for removal. Recommend that the patient gets an HPV vaccine if they have not yet done so.

hpv.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

anemia.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care.

medications.text: Iron supplements (Ferrous Sulfate 325), 3 tablets per day, taken every alternate day for 3 months

oral-thrush.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 2 days.

medications.text: Nystatin oral gel, applies three times a day

typhoid.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if their symptoms last more than 3-5 days or if there are any emergency signs.

medications.text: Ciprofloxacin, (Adults) 500mg, twice daily for 7 days; (Children) 30mg/kg divided in two doses a day for 7 days
Oral Rehydration Salts or Fluids (if dehydrated)

typhoid.other-recommendations: Provide counseling to the patient on prevention practies and encourage them to practice good hygeine.

cholera.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if their symptoms last more than 3 days or if there are any emergency signs.

medications.text: Oral Rehydration Salts or Fluids (if dehydrated)

cholera.other-recommendations: Provide counseling to the patient on prevention practies and encourage them to practice good hygeine.

meningitis.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

epilepsy.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.
epilepsy.other-recommendations: Provide epilepsy first aid to the patient.

dehydration.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care.

medications.text: Oral Rehydration Salts, for <2 years, 50-100ml after each loose stool. For >2 years, 100-200ml after each loose stool. Alternatively, give ORS every 4 hours.
Zinc supplements (children), 20mg per day for 14 days (10mg per day if less than 2 years)

dehydration.other-recommendations: If the patient's symptoms are severe, recommend that they get treated at the hospital. If the child is breastfeeding, continue breastfeeding.

htn.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

scabies.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

gastroenteritis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care. They should seek medical attention if they experience excessive pain, excessive vomitting or diarrhoea, if there are any emergency signs, or if the patient is pregnant

medications.text: Oral Rehydration Salts or Fluids (if dehydrated)

gastroenteritis.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient rests and avoids eating milk-based foods.

heat-rash.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care.

medications.text: Topical Corticosteroid Cream (if severe), apply 2-3 times a day on the affected areas

heat-rash.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient wear cool cotton clothing and that they ventilate their room.

stomatitis.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 2 days.

bacteremia.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

cephalohematoma.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care.
cephalohematoma.other-recommendations: Provide counseling that the condition will likely go away on it's own. Recommend that the patient seeks medical care if the symptoms do not resolve.

tinea-corporis.refer-and-triage-level: The patient can recieve home based care.

medications.text: Fluconzaole, for adults: 150mg once a week for 4 weeks. For children: 7mg/kg once a week for 4 weeks

bact-skin-infection-impetigo.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

umb-cord-sepsis.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

sepsis-changed-from-septicaemia.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

ped-hiv-aids.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

hepatitis-b.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility. They should seek care within 2 days. They should seek medical care immediately if there are signs of liver failure.

toxoplasmosis.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.

pneumocystis-pneumonia.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.
pneumocystis-pneumonia.other-recommendations: If the patient is a smoker, recommend that they stop smoking.

ectopic-pregnancy.refer-and-triage-level: Refer the patient to a health facility immediately.
ectopic-pregnancy.other-recommendations: Recommend that the patient goes to a health facility immediately as they will likely need surgery.
